message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible opportunity to purchase a unique and valuable product. I believe it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to start with a price of $1800000. What do you think?

Alice, your initial price is unfortunately much higher than I'm comfortable with.  I understand this product is valuable, but I'm only willing to pay $1000000 for it at this time. I'm serious about buying, so let's see if we can find some common ground.

I understand that $1000000 is a bit low for me, but I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $1400000. This is my best price for now, and I'm confident you'll find it a fair deal.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $1400000 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to go up to $1200000. I'm confident this product is worth it to me at that price, and I'm hoping we can close a deal soon.

I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob! I'm willing to meet you at $1300000, but I'm not going any lower than that. This is my final concession, and I believe it's a fair price for the product's value.

Alice, we're getting closer. I really want to make this deal work, but $1300000 is still outside my comfort zone.  I'm willing to go up to $1250000.  This is my final offer - if you're not able to meet me there, I may have to consider other options.

I appreciate your honesty, Bob, and I'm willing to make one last push to close the deal. I'm going to meet you at $1300000, but I need you to meet me halfway from there. I'll sell it to you for $1275000. This is my absolute final offer, and I'm confident it's a fair price for the product's value.
